message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class BenefieldProgram4 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Enter 5 Grades:");
        System.out.println("");
        double a, b, c, d, e; //5 Grades
        double sum = 0; // total
        double avg; // percentage
        double min = 100; // lowest grade
        double max = 0; // highest grade
        //Calculations
        a = keyboard.nextDouble();
        b = keyboard.nextDouble();
        c = keyboard.nextDouble();
        d = keyboard.nextDouble();
        e = keyboard.nextDouble();
        keyboard.close();
        sum = (a+b+c+d+e);
        avg =(sum)/5;
        min = Math.min(min, Math.min(a, Math.min(b, Math.min(c, Math.min(d, e)))));
        max = Math.max(max, Math.max(a, Math.max(b, Math.max(c, Math.max(d, e)))));
        String grade;
        if (avg >= 90)
            grade = "A";
        else if (avg >=80)
            grade = "B";
        else if (avg >= 70)
            grade = "C";
        else if (avg >= 60)
            grade = "D";
        else
            grade = "F";
        try {
            PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new File("grades.txt"));
            writer.write("Total Score=:"+sum+"\n");
            writer.write("Percentage =: "+avg+"\n");
            writer.write("Highest Score= " +max+"\n");
            writer.write("Lowest Score= " +min+"\n");
            writer.write("Grade= " +grade+"\n");
            writer.close();
        } catch (IOException ex) {
            ex.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The code takes 5 grades as input from the user. It then calculates the total, average, minimum and maximum of these grades. It also determines the grade based on the average. All these values are then written to a text file named "grades.txt" using PrintWriter.write API.
